data.text: @katiecouric May your Sister RIP until the PROMISED resurrection outlined at John 11:23-25 learn more from #jw
@katiecouric So sorry for your loss
@katiecouric A shining light dulled too soon. Still burning in the hearts of many who knew her.
@katiecouric Great Emily
@katiecouric @katiecouric So very sorry for your loss as you remember your sister today ♥️🤗😢
@katiecouric 🙏👏 🇺🇸

@katiecouric @LazarexCF Lost husband to pancreatic cancer at 37. Why we help patients participate in ct's @LazarexCF . Also why we are so proud to work with @SU2C to knock down barriers to participation!
@katiecouric She was guest speaker(employee inservice) for local school system for which i was once employed. Very talented. I remember feeling inspired as a young woman.

@katiecouric @hilaryr I'm so very sorry to hear. The day before one of my grandfather's had passed away 47 yrs ago. I was only 1yrs old so I never had the chance to know him. So I share in your grief around this time. However, your sister would be so proud of all the women running for public office.
@katiecouric @bob_levitt She’s beautiful, you look a lot alike. Sorry for your loss. Go women!
@katiecouric I can see a little of you in your sisters face; she lives on through her family.
@katiecouric @shmoozr I'm sorry for your loss.
@katiecouric I remember. Sorry for your loss. 😢

@katiecouric We think of you and her whenever we drive by the UVA cancer center named in her honor. So sorry for your loss, the pain may fade over time but never disappears. Our daughter is a double Hoo, Medicine, working towards GI. God Bless💕
@katiecouric I met her when I gave a speech on education as a member of my school board. She praised me highly and outlined a way for me to run for office.  I wish I'd done it. She was amazing
@katiecouric I remember when she was running..it was so exciting. Bless her soul!
@katiecouric My sister died 18 years ago of pancreatic cancer. Let’s remember them always
@katiecouric I see you through her. I believe she is extremely proud of you.❤️
@katiecouric She’s beautiful
@katiecouric #rememberingemily

@katiecouric We've always loved you here in Georgia. Our condolences. Stay sweet, charming, wise and intelligent. Wish you would run for Something, Anything! With all our love to your family.  ❤️❤️❤️!
@katiecouric I know how you feel. My sister was just diagnosed with stage 4 pancreatic cancer at age 66. Very cruel..

@katiecouric I had the privilege of caring for patients in the Emily Couric Cancer Center at #UVA and happy that our @MDAndersonNews #Immunotherapy clinical trial of tumor infiltrating lymphocytes (#TIL) includes a #PancreaticCancer cohort.
@katiecouric @chefjoseandres Sorry
@katiecouric We must,we must, WE MUST find a cure for this death sentence!

@katiecouric Thank you!  She was a trailblazer, like you!  We are fortunate to have many highly qualified women running for Congressional seats in VA like @SpanbergerVA07 @LeslieCockburn @Vangie4Congress @ElaineLuriaVA and @JenniferForVA.

@katiecouric Hi Katie, you don't know me..however I am sending you and your family good energy and peace for this day...be gentle with yourself, have a beautiful cup of tea and just breathe...Emily sits quietly on your shoulder...she would be soooooo happy and proud of you and your girls!!
@katiecouric So sorry 😐
@katiecouric Sorry for your loss!
@katiecouric She is beautiful. You must be so proud of who she was.
@katiecouric I remember Emily from Mr. Bell’s Latin class at Yorktown.  Wasn’t at all surprised at her success in life.  So sorry for your loss.
@katiecouric She was beautyful, I'm sorry for you losed. Today October 19  I'm commemorating International Day of Cancer de mama (Breast Cancer)
@katiecouric She definitely looked like you! I hope she's in heaven saying "You go, girls!"
@katiecouric @PalomaStovall ❤️
@katiecouric In VA we miss her too! She would have become our first woman governor. We share in your loss.
@katiecouric 💜
@katiecouric ❤❤❤🙏🙏🙏
@katiecouric @ProfCiara I was prez of the law dems during my time as one of her constituents. She was awesome. My ❤️ to you!
@katiecouric Good steps for her spirit of mercy

@katiecouric @karaswisher Sorry to learn of the anniversary of your loss...has the medical system learned anything, and are the statistics better now, in terms of early diagnosis, successful treatment and reduced mortality rate?
@katiecouric She so beautiful. Sorry, Katie, for your loss.
@katiecouric Certainly had same smile as you.
@katiecouric Is great to see how we women came a long way she would be so proud all the new discoveries in research
@katiecouric 😘
@katiecouric @agingactivist1 Thoughts are with your beautiful sister! She would be proud of all the women stepping up today!
@katiecouric I remember and wanted to vote for her.  Prayers for you. Hang on to the memories.
@katiecouric Oh I’m so sorry Katie. How painful for you. She looks so much like you. Hugs.
@katiecouric Never knew that. Thanks for sharing I know it must be hard.  Very strong genes in your family...same gorgeous smile...RIP Emily...
@katiecouric So sorry for loss
@katiecouric Katie, I don't know if you'll actually read my tweet, but I'm running for NH state rep and i'll hold Emily's spirit with me. If I win on Nov 6 (which is looking good), she wins, too.
@katiecouric She would have been out first female Governor, no doubt. Have yet to have one.
@katiecouric @CouricScholar
@katiecouric You look alike.
@katiecouric A beautiful woman taken from this earth too soon.
@katiecouric #stunning
@katiecouric She is timeless
@katiecouric ❤️❤️❤️❤️
@katiecouric Pretty, like you!

@katiecouric I work for @PanCAN and met @timkaine earlier this year. He immediately told me of your sister and her story. When she stepped down, that led to his running. He says he thinks of her often and how he’d rather she still be here partnering with him
@katiecouric So sorry Ms Couric..lost both my parents to this horribly fast death..what are the odds? Me and my 5 sisters wonder about everyday.

@katiecouric Was diagnosed with breast cancer right after Emily’s diagnosis. Saw her in session while I was there for award ceremony and in treatment. She inspired me to keep pushing on and I figured if she could work in wig so could I. RIP Emily!

@katiecouric So sorry for the loss of your sister.  I lost my sister also 17 years ago on New Years Eve 2001/2002.  She lived a full life and was 91 when she died.  She did and accomplished everything a woman would want to do.  Still miss her a lot.
@katiecouric I wish I had some words of wisdom......but all I can say is today would have made her proud to know women are running and winning today
@katiecouric we miss her.
@katiecouric She was beautiful, sorry for your loss
@katiecouric So sorry @katiecouric I'm sure you miss her every single day
@katiecouric Awww she looks just like you 💜
@katiecouric I can’t imagine how heartbreaking it would be to lose a sibling and so young. Your work and your words honor her.
@katiecouric With you in prayer, Katie. We just lost a dear friend to this under-researched disease.
@katiecouric Beautiful, courageous, strong.🙏
@katiecouric Sorry for your loss, Ma’am :(
@katiecouric @RonaldKlain So sad.  I'm sure she was as lovely as you.
@katiecouric She did a lot for Virginia in the time she had. That's not forgotten.

@katiecouric You never get over the loss of a sibling. It creates a deep hole in your heart and soul. Mine passed away 50 years ago and I still have a deep emptiness. It is wonderful that you are preventing so many from feeling this loss.
@katiecouric 😢🙏

@katiecouric 😢 so sorry Katie. You have suffered so much and have been an inspiration for so many. I lost my sister 20 years ago this year and my brother this past June. They were both younger than me. Our hearts always hurt, but we keep on moving. ❤️💙
@katiecouric Thanks you for lending your voice to a cause that resonates so deeply with those of us who have have lost loved ones to this awful killer!!!
@katiecouric @carolynryan Very sorry for your loss.

@katiecouric @carolynryan Katie, my eldest sister, Margaret, also died from pancreatic cancer, seven years ago. Seven months from diagnosis to her passing. So cruel, so unfair. A wonderful lady. Take care.

@katiecouric Katie, I feel connected to you in so many ways!  Your sister was beautiful and sounds like an amazing woman!  My husband also passed away from PC at age 51 in 2006-very young-just like your sweet husband Jay( I know his was colon cancer, but still way too young)😘
@katiecouric @carolynryan So beautiful and alive...reminds me of her sister Katie. She would be proud of you, Ms. Couric!
@katiecouric So sorry for the lost of your sister but I bit she was proud of you and would love for you to be in the fight for women.
@katiecouric So sorry Katie. This year I will vote in memory of Emily. #rememberingemily 💙

@katiecouric @RonaldKlain I still think of Emily so often and have shared stories of her strength and commitment to service with many other women candidates over the years. She was an extraordinary public servant, candidate and friend whose presence never fades #rememberingemily

@katiecouric I got to know you Katie during winter of 1990. I was home on maternity leave and remember when you were given The Today Show.  You would share personal events like the birth of your daughters and the passing of your sister and husband. Those were things I could relate to.
@katiecouric She was a rising star...
@katiecouric Emily came to speak to my students at Prospect Heights Middle School, in Orange, VA. Always appreciated!

@katiecouric Hey there! I’ve had breast cancer, thyroid cancer and for the last 6 years, I’ve been battling pancreatic cancer! 80 rounds of chemo later, I’ll continue to fight for those who shouldn’t have died of this disease and push for an earlier diagnosis and better treatment!!
@katiecouric So beautiful, Katie.  Thinking of you.
@katiecouric Prayers
@katiecouric Tri Delt Sister....I am thinking of you , and the wonderful things your sister did and inspired others to do .   With love, Donna Derr Naybor ( College 77)
@katiecouric @RonaldKlain she looks like you. So sorry. For those two big losses.
@katiecouric @hilaryr ❤️❤️
@katiecouric @hilaryr You two look so much alike. She was a beautiful lady.
@katiecouric Inspiring and much love!
@katiecouric @lustgartenfdn
@katiecouric @karaswisher Then am sure she would be proud of @emilyslist who has enabled thousands of women to run for office. They are doing such a great job, will make the country a better place.
@katiecouric @karaswisher Remember it well..
@katiecouric I’m so sorry for your loss and I’m sure you think of her every day. #sisterlove
@katiecouric She was beautiful, just as you are!! I'm sure looks over you very proudly. 💌
@katiecouric She had my support, and she definitely had my vote. I was looking forward to her, someday, running for the presidency. 😢❤️😢

@katiecouric I lost my Mom to pancreatic cancer last week, 11 months after she was diagnosed... I hated being helpless watching her suffer and in pain and nothing I could do to alleviate her suffering...
@katiecouric Lost my dad 2 years ago to pancreatic cancer so sad .... ❤️

@katiecouric I'm sure she would, and of you too @katiecouric 
#Angels

@katiecouric My sister Patty's birthday is today, she died at 41, miss her so much. My big sister was a force for sure.  Do you ever look at your sisters life and think how did she know to run fast through it? It's like they knew of there short life span and just charged at it.
@katiecouric So sorry for the losses you have had Katie. I know your Sister is looking down on you with pride ((❤️))
@katiecouric Glad I had the chance to meet her. We had fun watching the NBA dunking contest with Mark Warner.

@katiecouric My husband and i had recently moved to Charlottesville before this and had dinner at her home. I still keep the C-village weekly article about her passing because she was such an inspiration.
@katiecouric A beautiful woman!
@katiecouric 😢❤️
@katiecouric 😢💔💔💔
@katiecouric Prayers, Katie!!!
@katiecouric Is there a foundation for her? We need more pancreatic cancer research!
@katiecouric I remember your sister's passing, although it is hard to believe it has been 17 yrs. Sorry for your loss, even after all of these years.
@katiecouric She favors you.
@katiecouric Wow you two look like twins. that’s another disease I wish we had a better way to fight.
@katiecouric So very sorry.
@katiecouric You’re a good sister to share your memories of your sister. It shows a lot of love and admiration.
@katiecouric Sorry for your loss. You’re a good sister to share
@katiecouric 🙏🏽😌💟

@katiecouric We're so sorry for your loss and sending you and your family warm thoughts today. We continue to #WageHope in her honor and for all those we've lost too soon. Thank you for always helping to raise awareness.
@katiecouric Such a tragic loss, for your family, and not the only one. Your strength and courage, inspire. So touching how you keep Emily's memory alive.
@katiecouric My mom passed away, as well, from this horrible disease in 2000. #FundPancreaticCancerResearch #FindACure
@katiecouric So sorry for your loss
@katiecouric Katie-my sister has pancreatic cancer and my heart breaks daily. Thank you for sharing your sister with us. Sisters are the best!
@katiecouric She was a beautiful person who would have been an amazing Lt. Governor!  I remember how sad that was. You certainly have had your share of losses. Stay strong Katie!!
@katiecouric @katiecouric perhaps you should take her place?
@katiecouric Thinking of Emily, you and your family today🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽.
@katiecouric I remember that. She would have made a terrific https://t.co/1owZb74tsI. and eventally Governor.
@katiecouric 😍🙏
@katiecouric Blessing🙏🙏🙏🙏
@katiecouric Sorry for your loss Katy. She seems as if she was a remarkable woman.

@katiecouric My god, woman, you've really had more than your share. A sister is one of the hardest, i think, and one of the few close ones I haven't had to bear. Did you see I've been trying to get in touch w you about my new book about death and mourning? I'm back on our old beat...
@katiecouric Allow her Spirit to continue to Inspire (In-Spirit) You. Write your story.
@katiecouric We loved your sister. My father-in-law worked next to her in the VA senate.
@katiecouric So sweet
@katiecouric Cancer also robbed me my baby sister, an amazing woman, wife, mother and judge.  There is not a day that I miss her love and laughter around for us...
@katiecouric So sorry for your loss...she looks and sounds like a wonderful woman.
@katiecouric There’s still time for you to run, Katie.
@katiecouric You should run for office and carry onEmily's tradition. Let's start a movement to raise funds to find a cure for pancreatic cancer.

@katiecouric Prayer is answer to every problem in life. Read the privilege of prayer chapter in Steps to Christ by Ellen White on line free of charge for inspiration. Call 24/7 prayer line of healing at 18053092350 password 1001844#.Don't forget to read the Ministry of Healing by E. White https://t.co/RxnipHy6eF
@katiecouric Wow - so sorry Katie. Beautiful woman taking too early. I sure see the resemblance. Sending warm thoughts your way.
@katiecouric You have been through it haven’t you? I’m sure your family would be proud that your honouring their legacy

@katiecouric Having just sat with my cousin as she passed away from cancer at the age of 54 I know that the void doesn't ever get filled when we lose someone.  Your sister would most definitely be proud of the women moving forward to serve the American people!
@katiecouric We lost my mom to pancreatic cancer 8 years ago. She was a big fan of yours, Katie!
@katiecouric Beautiful. Love from Canada.
@katiecouric So sorry for your loss. You know she is watching and proud of all the incredible work you do
@katiecouric May your sister RIP and she is proud of you
@katiecouric I work near the Emily Couric Cancer Center. Amazing work is happening there, and I think she would be proud of that, too.

@katiecouric So sorry for your loss. Years may pass but loss always touches us in our daily lives.  Thankfully it can also be mixed with good memories and meaningful legacies. She helped pave ways for other women. So have you. Thank you.
@katiecouric Sweet tribute, sorry for your loss and loss for all of Virginia.
@katiecouric She is beautiful
@katiecouric ❤️❤️
@katiecouric 💜💜💜
@katiecouric <3
@katiecouric she looks just like you!
@katiecouric ❤️
